HeroSection.description: SALTO is a project launched by the University of Turin with the goal of connecting foreign citizens and healthcare professionals by improving access to health information, fostering inclusion, and facilitating access to services.

Healthy diet.title: Healthy diet
Healthy diet.description: Discover the importance of a balanced diet.

Correct use of medicines.title: Proper use of medications
Correct use of medicines.description: Understand how to use medications safely.

Pregnancy.title: Pregnancy
Pregnancy.description: Get information on pregnancy and childbirth.

Pediatric care.title: Pediatric care
Pediatric care.description: Learn about pediatric care and child health.

Skin conditions.title: Skin conditions
Skin conditions.description: Explore common skin conditions and treatments.

Access to healthcare.title: Access to healthcare
Access to healthcare.description: Learn about healthcare access and services.

Prevention.title: Lifestyle and prevention
Prevention.description: Discover why prevention and healthy lifestyle are important.

UpcomingEvents.title: Upcoming Events
UpcomingEvents.description: Stay updated with our latest events and activities.

event1.title: Health Workshop
event1.description: Join us for a workshop on health and wellness.

event2.title: Community Meeting
event2.description: A meeting to discuss community health initiatives.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Here you can find the most common questions and answers about the project.

Resources.premiseThirdPartyResources: In this section, you’ll find helpful materials created outside the SALTO project to support people of non-Italian origin in staying healthy.

childrensHealth.LIFESTYLE: HEALTHY DIET AND LIFESTYLE IN CHILDREN

Footer.fundingDescription: SALTO received funding through the University of Turin’s 2023 Call for Public Engagement Projects (Rectoral Decree No. 5404/2023, Prot. No. 0564338, dated October 10, 2023).

Goal3.label: Health
Goal3.description: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages

objective1.description: By 2030, reduce the global maternal mortality ratio to less than 70 per 100,000 live births.

objective2.description: By 2030, end preventable deaths of newborns and children under 5 years of age, with all countries aiming to reduce neonatal mortality to at least as low as 12 per 1,000 live births and under-5 mortality to at least as low as 25 per 1,000 live births.

objective3.description: By 2030, end the epidemics of AIDS, tuberculosis, malaria and neglected tropical diseases and combat hepatitis, water-borne diseases and other communicable diseases.

objective4.description: By 2030, reduce by one third premature mortality from non-communicable diseases through prevention and treatment and promote mental health and well-being.

objective5.description: Strengthen the prevention and treatment of substance abuse, including narcotic drug abuse and harmful use of alcohol.

objective6.description: By 2020, halve the number of global deaths and injuries from road traffic accidents.

objective7.description: By 2030, ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health-care services, including for family planning, information and education, and the integration of reproductive health into national strategies and programmes.

objective8.description: Achieve universal health coverage, including financial risk protection, access to quality essential health-care services and access to safe, effective, quality and affordable essential medicines and vaccines for all.

objective9.description: By 2030, substantially reduce the number of deaths and illnesses from hazardous chemicals and air, water and soil pollution and contamination.

objectiveA.title: 3.a
objectiveA.description: Strengthen the implementation of the World Health Organization Framework Convention on Tobacco Control in all countries, as appropriate.

objectiveB.title: 3.b
objectiveB.description: Support the research and development of vaccines and medicines for the communicable and noncommunicable diseases that primarily affect developing countries, provide access to affordable essential medicines and vaccines, in accordance with the Doha Declaration on the TRIPS Agreement and Public Health, which affirms the right of developing countries to use to the full the provisions in the Agreement on Trade Related Aspects of Intellectual Property Rights regarding flexibilities to protect public health, and, in particular, provide access to medicines for all.

objectiveC.title: 3.c
objectiveC.description: Substantially increase health financing and the recruitment, development, training and retention of the health workforce in developing countries, especially in least developed countries and small island developing States.

objectiveD.title: 3.d
objectiveD.description: Strengthen the capacity of all countries, in particular developing countries, for early warning, risk reduction and management of national and global health risks.

Goal10.label: Inequality
Goal10.description: Reduce inequality within and among countries

objective1.description: By 2030, progressively achieve and sustain income growth of the bottom 40 per cent of the population at a rate higher than the national average.

objective2.description: By 2030, empower and promote the social, economic and political inclusion of all, irrespective of age, sex, disability, race, ethnicity, origin, religion or economic or other status.

objective3.description: Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard.

objective4.description: Adopt policies, especially fiscal, wage and social protection policies, and progressively achieve greater equality.

objective5.description: Improve the regulation and monitoring of global financial markets and institutions and strengthen the implementation of such regulations.

objective6.description: Ensure enhanced representation and voice for developing countries in decision-making in global international economic and financial institutions in order to deliver more effective, credible, accountable and legitimate institutions.

objective7.description: Facilitate orderly, safe, regular and responsible migration and mobility of people, including through the implementation of planned and well-managed migration policies.

objectiveA.title: 10.a
objectiveA.description: Implement the principle of special and differential treatment for developing countries, in particular least developed countries, in accordance with World Trade Organization agreements.

objectiveB.title: 10.b
objectiveB.description: Encourage official development assistance and financial flows, including foreign direct investment, to States where the need is greatest, in particular least developed countries, African countries, small island developing States and landlocked developing countries, in accordance with their national plans and programmes.

objectiveC.title: 10.c
objectiveC.description: By 2030, reduce to less than 3 per cent the transaction costs of migrant remittances and eliminate remittance corridors with costs higher than 5 per cent.
